page.title: 03 CAMPING-THE SHAWS & GUIDING
page.content: {"The Shaws"} is sited in the village of Cudham and is used by the London and South-East England Region of the {Girl Guides Association}. Its 98 acres of fields and woodland contain 19 camping plots and 3 Pack Holiday Houses for use by Brownies. There are 2 main camping areas. The upper site contains the camp shop, Warden's house and Brownie huts. This is separated from the lower site by a strip of woodland, at the south end of which is the Camp Fire Circle. The site is habitat for much wildlife, other than Guides and Brownies! The girls camping there have been known to have their foodstores stolen by badgers in the night. Foxes and Grass Snakes are also residents. 1985 marked the {75th anniversary of the Guiding Movement} and on July 6th, 6,000 Guides and Brownies converged on Cudham to celebrate the anniversary.
